ue"><ServiceStatus> = “SBDB” then “STANDBY DEBOARDED”

  • When <ServiceStatus> = ”SBC” then “STANDBY CLEARED” else “OTHER“

    • | # Flight PAX SSR Data Model (NEW Release) ### Data Retrieval > For PNR messages received in the `com.riverx.topic.in.commercial.pnrretrieve.handler` EventHub Topic, refer to :paperclip: PNR Data Retrieval. {.is-info} #### - Data Retrieval Scope * Retrieve newly published events from the relevant EventHub topic. #### - Source Event Broker Topic * `pnrretrieve`: `com.riverx.topic.in.commercial.pnrretrieve.handler` #### - Data Retrieval Trigger & Steps **Trigger:** Each new event published to the topic **Steps:** Retrieve events #### - Data Handling Operation * When the event header's `content-type` attribute is “application/gzip”, decode the event value from Base64 format and decompress it. * Flight Pax SSR records are generated through the `` elements, which include the special service requests' details. * PNR information is assigned to Flight Pax SSR records through the `` element. * The `flightPaxInfoOrderId` attribute of the Flight Pax SSR record is set to a combination of the `pnr`, `pnrCreationDate`, `paxReferenceId` and `segmentReferenceId` attributes(see Mapping for details). * The `flightPaxSsrId` attribute of the Flight Pax SSR record is set to a combination of the `pnr`, `pnrCreationDate`, `paxReferenceId`, `segmentReferenceId` and `ssrReferenceId` attributes(see Mapping for details). * The `ssrStatus` attribute of the Flight Pax SSR record is assigned through the `.` element. * When `....` = “OK“ then “ACTIVE“, else “CANCELLED“ * The `flightId` is assigned to Flight Pax SSR records through the `` element. * SSR details are assigned to Fli
